articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website
articles.contents:
Welcome to the Massachusetts Data Science Pathways project.
This organization is for Massachusetts educators and other
stakeholders focused on data science pathways from high school through
two- and four- colleges and universities.
For more information please contact Nicholas Horton
(Amherst College).

Here is the current list:
Non-digest (regular) members: bbaumer@smith.edu (Ben Baumer) jbrownsederberg@massasoit.mass.edu (Janet
Brown-Sederberg) nhorton@amherst.edu (Nicholas Horton) cdorsey@concord.org
(Chad Dorsey) ddamelin@concord.org (Dan Damelin) vhill@stcc.edu (Hill,
Vanessa) nicholasjhorton@gmail.com (Nicholas Horton) andee_rubin@terc.edu (Andee Rubin) afarikumahe@gcc.mass.edu (Eben Afarikumah) adustin78@smith.edu
(Andrea Dustin) bcheikes@cs.umass.edu (Brant Cheikes) ajcollins@stcc.edu
(Collins, Andrew) Digest members: vbarr@mtholyoke.edu (Valerie Barr) mdharris@bhcc.edu
(Harris, Michael)
You can get this any time you want! Just address an email to ma-ds-pathways-request@cs.umass.edu. No subject line,
and an otherwise empty message body except for “who yourpassword”.
Send the message and the listserver will reply with the current
membership.
If you don’t know your listserver password, just send a message to
the -request address above, but with the word “password” in the message
body. The server will send you your password, which you can then use in
the “who” request.

articles.title: Massachusetts Data Science Pathways project
articles.contents:
This website describes the Massachusetts Data Science Pathways
project.
The organization is intended for Massachusetts educators and other
stakeholders focused on data science pathways from high school through
two- and four- colleges and universities.
To join our low volume mailing list please send an email
ma-ds-pathways-join AT cs.umass.edu. The subject and body
of the message will be ignored, so it doesn’t matter what you
provide.

and Simplifying Data Science Transfer Pathways in Massachusetts
